intro: Andryala integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf andryala, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
